column4: .@USDOL’s exemption is a welcome step to provide regulatory relief to the VAHBP health care and long-term care providers that serve our #veterans, making it easier to contract with @DeptVetAffairs to provide care for veterans closer to home. https://t.co/yHbFL56VNf

As chair of Ag Approps, I worked to include $20B in direct funding to assist our farmers and ranchers who have faced real challenges during this pandemic and yet still continued to provide food, fuel and fiber to meet our needs.

The relief legislation we voted on in the Senate today would provide assistance in a targeted way to help address impacts from the COVID-19 pandemic. These are areas with bipartisan support and the legislation should not have been blocked.

The Continuing PPP Act would provide vital assistance for the small businesses who have been hardest hit during the pandemic. Support for small biz should have broad bipartisan support and this legislation should not have been blocked from consideration. https://t.co/yVVbnZ6oP4

We appreciate USDA for providing these flexibilities and all of the school nutrition professionals in #NorthDakota, who work tirelessly to provide students with healthy, nutritious meals. https://t.co/rmyPUbHSo3

Our health care professionals are on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic every day & this week I had the opportunity to thank members of the @NDMedAssn for their essential service. https://t.co/AxPlADld5r
Mikey and I are praying for @RealDonaldTrump, @FLOTUS and all those with COVID-19. Wishing them a speedy recovery and grateful for all our health care workers on the frontlines.

Our veterans deserve the highest caliber of support & the new @fargovahcs Community Resource & Referral Center will serve as a resource in the FM area, connecting #NDveterans w/ the housing, health care & career development services they have earned. https://t.co/5FiXI94dLh

.@USDA has released details for CFAP2 relief using the $14B in CCC funding we secured in the #CARESAct. The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted the ag economy & we’ll cont. working to provide assistance to help our farmers & ranchers. Sign up starts Sept. 21. https://t.co/dZq5ptRMie https://t.co/vtUaVAA0pq

.@realDonaldTrump announced CFAP 2.0 relief for farmers & ranchers using the $14B in CCC funding we secured in the #CARESAct. Appreciate his administration’s ongoing support for our ag producers as they face challenges from weather, markets + COVID-19. https://t.co/XC9twuCpM4

VA Under Secretary for Benefits Paul Lawrence will hold a live call today with #NorthDakota veterans & their families to provide an update on @DeptVetAffairs programs and COVID19 response. The call starts at 4 CT today and interested ND veterans can call-in at: 833.380.0417

Recognizing Veteran & Military Suicide Prevention Awareness Day in #ND & #WorldSuicidePreventionDay today as September is National Suicide Awareness Month. I remain committed to ensuring our veterans & servicemembers receive the health care & benefits they have earned.
My statement today after the targeted COVID-19 relief package was blocked: https://t.co/t6f3lcujrF

As chair of Ag Approps, I worked to ensure the targeted COVID-19 assistance proposal includes $20B in direct funding, which combined with the $14B in CCC replenishment from the #CARESAct will provide USDA w/ $34B to help our ag producers weather the challenges in farm country.

We are working to provide targeted assistance to help overcome challenges of the coronavirus pandemic. The proposal released today includes support for testing & vaccines, postal service, education, small businesses + unemployment and economic needs.
RT @SecBrouillette: Thank you @SenJohnHoeven, @SenKevinCramer, and Governor @DougBurgum for your hospitality throughout my visit yesterday.…

Discussed w/ #NDag producers today our ongoing efforts to ensure CCC & CFAP funding is used as effectively as possible – an important support as we work to secure add. funding to assist farmers & ranchers in the next COVID-19 response legislation. https://t.co/rlfu1sFQOW

At the same time, we need to continue working to find consensus on targeted legislation to help safely reopen schools, provide funding for more testing, continue supporting small businesses, including our farmers and ranchers, and assist those most in need.

The President’s executive orders will provide an additional $400 in unemployment benefits to help those who lost their jobs due to COVID-19, continue relief for student loan borrowers, and prevent evictions.

The President acted to provide relief to Americans impacted by the pandemic. Given the stalemate in discussions on the next phase of COVID-19 relief, the President is using all options to provide support to the American people.

Our producers have faced real challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic & we appreciate @usdafsa providing producers utilizing the FSFL program the flexibility of a payment deferral option. Producers should contact their local FSA office for additional information. https://t.co/7QymOF3LL2

The Senate has passed legislation to improve VA mental health treatment options. I cosponsored this leg. to support expanded access to HBOT & alternative treatments to PTS and other mental health challenges #NDveterans work to overcome. https://t.co/kJGVwmNgvZ

Thanked #ND health care providers as well as community members who have stepped up to assist our medical professionals today on the Senate floor. We appreciate the efforts of all those who have been working to prevent the spread of this virus & treat those affected. https://t.co/80om4KRle5

Our producers need flexibility and support to manage their operations during this public health emergency & I appreciate @usdaRMA easing the payment timeline for crop insurance which will help ensure farmers don’t face increased costs. https://t.co/6r6nZy4ARX

Spoke w/ @TeamCavuto today about the ongoing negotiations for an additional COVID-19 relief package. The next bill needs to provide support for individuals, families & small biz in a targeted manner to ultimately help get people back to work safely and the economy going again. https://t.co/B19qJCLzl0
This legislation will help ensure we can mitigate the long-term impacts of COVID-19 on farm country & I am hopeful that we can pass this relief for producers in a timely way. https://t.co/DjGnyLgk3L

These two new loan options for non-profits will serve as useful tools in maintaining their operations through COVID-19. This announcement complements our efforts to ensure the MSLP can be utilized by a wide variety of businesses & others in #NorthDakota. https://t.co/XDhQQecWIE

Held a virtual roundtable w/ #NDag groups today as we work to cont. providing assistance to our producers. The CFAP was a good step in helping producers weather the challenges of COVID-19 but it's vital we secure add. assistance that works for farm country.

Today, @USDA_APHIS announced the first investment in the national animal vaccine bank we established in the 2018 Farm Bill. This funding toward a FMD vaccine will help address risks to animal health & provide important safeguards for our nation’s livestock industry.

The Fed reduced interest rates specifically to help businesses through this difficult time, and it makes sense to enable rural electric coops & telecoms to benefit from this important tool, supporting a stronger recovery from COVID-19 in our rural communities.

Today @usdafsa will begin accepting applications online for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) we helped fund in the #CARESAct. Encourage #NDag producers to continue applying as we work to secure additional support for farmers & ranchers. https://t.co/94h0KOMqzb

Challenges of the COVID-19 public health emergency have delayed many of the projects, including those in the @CityofMinot region, funded by this program. Our bill will give the time needed to safely get back to work & finish critical disaster protection & resiliency efforts.

Today my good friend Lynn turns 99 years old. He fought at the Battle of the Bulge and was my SOTU guest a few years back. He means a great amount to Mikey & I, the Minot community and our entire state. We’re sending much health & happiness his way today. Happy birthday Lynn. https://t.co/JQyQncqUyS

The purpose of the #PaycheckProtectionProgram is to help small businesses weather the challenges of the pandemic & keep their employees on payroll, and this legislation we sent to President Trump today provides flexibility to better achieve these critical goals.

Broadening the use of the DSA loan provision will help provide loan relief to producers impacted by COVID-19. Reached out to @USDA about this and today’s announcement ensures much needed flexibility. https://t.co/UTsh586f2L

I look forward to working with the Administration to advance reg. relief that will get all sectors of our economy moving and growing again. Helping to reduce unnecessary burdens and costs, it makes sense to include this EO as part of the COVID-19 response.

Appreciate the Trump Administration working to support #ND’s efforts to beat COVID-19 & safely reopen. @realDonaldTrump joined our meeting today where I thanked him for his work and outlined the continued importance of assisting our agriculture + energy producers.
RT @USDA: The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) will provide up to $16 billion in direct payments to deliver relief to America’s f…
Look to the sky on Monday as @TeamMinot shows their appreciation for all #ND medical and health care professionals, essential employees & volunteers fighting COVID-19. https://t.co/cG9PiFyLi1

Thank you to our great teachers in #NorthDakota for making adjustments in order to continue your service to students through this pandemic. As the school year comes to a close, your commitment & dedication to our youth is always appreciated. Happy #TeacherAppreciationMonth. https://t.co/q7PfPSARDD
RT @DougBurgum: Appreciate the opportunity to share ND’s coronavirus successes and challenges with @POTUS at the White House today with @Se…

At the @WhiteHouse today, I joined Gov. @DougBurgum & President @realDonaldTrump for a discussion on combatting COVID-19 both at a state and federal level & further emphasized the importance of supporting agriculture + energy producers. https://t.co/1MZABe1uAj
RT @DougBurgum: Fighting COVID-19 requires a whole-of-government approach, and we’re fortunate to have the partnership of @POTUS and his ad…

#NDag producers & farmers and ranchers across the country have truly stepped up their efforts during the COVID-19 emergency to take care of not only their families, but their communities. Today I took my gratitude to the Senate floor to thank them for their efforts. https://t.co/3jPUdZytSV

Under Gov. @DougBurgum’s leadership, #ND is leading the way in testing, a key part of safely reopening the economy. We look forward to his visit to the @WhiteHouse tomorrow as he & President @realDonaldTrump discuss further efforts to work together + address the COVID pandemic.

Happy #NationalNursesDay – Nurses in #NorthDakota & across the nation have continued to sacrifice and serve on the front lines of this pandemic and we are grateful for their courage today & every day. #ThankYouNurses https://t.co/1Q7ro5XsCi

The guidance from @SecretarySonny helps reinforce the safe operation of meat processing facilities, supporting the integrity of our nation’s food supply chain, while helping preserve the health & well-being of this essential part of our economy. https://t.co/0pyXbYW1go

Had a good conversation w/ @Varneyco about ensuring the COVID19 response funds we’ve provided the states are working in an effective, flexible way + our efforts to support our farmers and ranchers, including investigating potential market manipulation. https://t.co/g0hZY3h7fl
RT @SBAgov: NEW: SBA is now accepting #COVID19 Economic Injury Disaster Loan and Advance applications for agricultural small businesses on…

President @realDonaldTrump has signed legislation to provide additional funding for small businesses, health care providers & hospitals as well as ensure farmers & ranchers are eligible for EIDL loans/grants. Great news as we all continue combatting the COVID19 pandemic.

Led my colleagues in pressing the Depts. of @USTreasury, @Energy & the @federalreserve to support our energy sector as it works to overcome COVID-19 & the price war by ensuring our oil+gas producers have access to credit through the 13(3) lending program. https://t.co/nHCRpAl0JJ

We’ve been working w/ the Administration to ensure Gov. @DougBurgum is able to use the funds from the Coronavirus Relief Fund to help offset the rise in unemployment insurance costs & meet #NorthDakota’s specific needs. https://t.co/KQp74JnzxR

Spoke w/ #NDag producers & commodity groups today to review the roll-out of @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program funded through the #CARESAct. The input gathered today is an important step in our ongoing efforts to support our ag producers through this pandemic.

The Senate approved legislation to provide additional funds to our health care providers, hospitals & small businesses. I encourage the House to pass the leg. quickly to provide vital funds, including the #PaycheckProtectionProgram, during this pandemic. https://t.co/qMQA4kU68U

Thanks to @realDonaldTrump & @stevenmnuchin1 for working on a deal to provide vital resources to combat health+economic impacts of COVID19. Had a good call w/them today & hope we’re close to an agreement to provide more resources to hospitals, testing& #PaycheckProtectionProgram.

Thanks @POTUS @realDonaldTrump for supporting our farmers & ranchers as they continue to provide our nation w/ food, fuel & fiber during this pandemic. We worked to secure the funding & authorization in the #CARESAct and will continue working w/ @SecretarySonny to support ag.

Joined by @USDOL @SecGeneScalia today, I discussed the #CARESAct & the federal government’s response to COVID-19 w/ @nodakchamber + @SBAgov, @fema, @NDWSI. It’s vital we gather feedback from #ND businesses to ensure a timely & strong recovery for our economy.

The funding provided in the #CARESAct will help cover the tremendous costs borne by our hospitals & providers facing reduced revenues. Today I brought together #ND health care leaders & administration officials to ensure our state’s needs are being heard. https://t.co/IWnau7XJuF

We had a good conversation today w/ @POTUS @realDonaldTrump about the importance of both beating the coronavirus, and having a plan in place to get our economy back up and running and Americans back to work as quickly and safely as possible.

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is clearly providing important support for #smallbiz & their employees. The PPP will help our economy to rebound more quickly once this public health emergency ends & Congress should agree to provide additional funding for this vital program now.

Many tribal communities are experiencing hardships due to COVID-19, and today I held a discussion w/ ND Tribal leadership & @HHSGov to outline the #CARESAct implementation and resources it provides Indian Tribes. https://t.co/eBAlpKlvhU
RT @USDA: We just launched the COVID-19 Federal Rural Resource Guide to help our rural leaders understand what federal assistance is availa…

This agreement to cut oil production is a welcome step toward providing stability in the global energy markets & helping #NDenergy and our domestic oil & gas producers to weather the economic challenges from COVID-19. https://t.co/AUB3rT0mGe
Teamed up w/ @SenJohnThune today to outline CARES Act assistance to help #SmallBiz, start-ups, independent & gig workers keep their operations afloat during the pandemic. https://t.co/Ii2VWaJnmW

Small businesses are the engine of our economy & the PPP provides support to #smallbiz + self-employed individuals. We need to approve additional funding to ensure that they’re able to weather the challenges posed by this pandemic. https://t.co/39wu2p9b6E

Joined my colleagues in urging @USTreasury Sec @stevenmnuchin1 to provide states w/ flexibility when implementing the Coronavirus Relief Fund authorized under the CARES Act. It’s vital we don’t tie up critical resources needed by state & local governments. https://t.co/lB41vrcQeK

Working to support #NDenergy producers & that includes stopping the global oil price war and managing our current supply as the demand has been impacted by COVID-19. I’ve spoke to the Administration about this + getting more petroleum in the SPR, helping producers & taxpayers. https://t.co/be6DzZ4uiV
RT @1MillionCupsND: We'll have a very special guest on stage tomorrow to address the 1MCND Community about COVID-19, the CARES Act, and the…

Joined Gov @DougBurgum tonight at the @NDDOH informational press briefing alongside @SenKevinCramer. The assistance provided under the CARES Act is essential support for our
▶️ health care providers
▶️ families
▶️ farmers
▶️ businesses
as we combat the spread of COVID-19.
RT @DougBurgum: Today’s press briefing on COVID-19 with @SenJohnHoeven and @SenKevinCramer begins at 4 p.m. CT. Watch live: https://t.co/Ix…

#NationalDoctorsDay provides another opportunity to express how grateful we are for our doctors. @NDDOH, physicians & health care workers in #NorthDakota are tireless in their efforts to combat coronavirus & we cannot thank them enough. https://t.co/5nbD5WPvhA

I spoke with Stuart on @Varneyco about our efforts w/ the Administration to put a stop to the global oil price war. We don’t need an oil price war while we're fighting this pandemic. Not only for #NDenergy, but this nation, we’ve got to get these other countries working with us. https://t.co/OujxpL5QR4

As we work to overcome the challenges of COVID-19, one of our many priorities is maintaining industries that are essential to our national security & quality of life, like our domestic energy industry. https://t.co/AzAywtjptj

.@POTUS has signed the CARES Act. Vital relief & assistance is on its way to families, health-care professionals, ag producers, small businesses, tribal communities + essential industries all impacted by COVID-19. Thank you @realDonaldTrump. https://t.co/K9ruoepLQ1

Today the House approved the CARES Act. This Phase III legislation will help us battle both the health & economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic while providing much needed support for the American people—look forward to @POTUS signing it.

Mikey & I join the people of North Dakota in extending our condolences to the loved ones of this individual. As we continue to combat COVID-19, we encourage everyone to take the appropriate steps and do their part in reducing the spread. https://t.co/OO7Jeuirmd

The Administration has extended the REAL ID enforcement deadline to October 1, 2021. This move provides much-needed flexibility and will help prevent unnecessary disruptions to travel once this pandemic has passed and we get our economy moving again. https://t.co/7NtL4su8Hn

I joined my Senate colleagues in voting for the CARES Act. This legislation provides vital relief & assistance to:
▶️ families
▶️ health care professionals
▶️ ag producers
▶️ small businesses
▶️ tribal communities
▶️ industries essential to our economy impacted by COVID-19 https://t.co/l7iJni1o5W
Small UAS can accelerate delivery of critically-needed supplies across the country, such as food and medicine, saving time and money, while also reducing the risks of transmitting COVID-19.
RT @HouseAgGOP: Democrats are again trying to deny vital aid to farmers and ranchers, this time via the Senate COVID-19 response. Thanks @S…

Our legislation would give taxpayers more time to submit their paperwork amid the Coronavirus outbreak. Given the public health challenges, this is common sense legislation that will help provide a little relief for American families. https://t.co/0LvoS9MKgK

Joined my Senate colleagues in passing legislation to assist families, workers & small businesses impacted by the #coronavirus. The legislation:  
▶️Ensures access to testing for the virus.
▶️Requires paid family, medical & sick leave to help prevent the spread of the disease.

…as well as conversations I’ve had with @POTUS & our letter to the Saudi Crown Prince. We will continue to press our ally on this matter, while also working on a stimulus package to help counter the widespread impact of coronavirus on our economy.

We need stability in the oil markets during these challenges with COVID-19 to ensure we don’t lose long-term capacity in this essential industry. That’s why we’ve been pressing to end Saudi’s price war with Russia, including in today’s call with the Saudi Ambassador…
As I told @LizMacDonaldFOX last night on @EveningEdit, the objective is to reduce the spread & continue working together to combat the coronavirus. https://t.co/YgdW6t8c5V

Cosponsored legislation to remove potential barriers & help ensure state + local health professionals have access to CDC-approved respirators when treating patients who may have the coronavirus. It’s vital our medical personnel are properly equipped. https://t.co/JGOHh69a5j

ND School Nutrition Association leaders stopped by my office this week. It’s vital ND students have access to affordable, healthy meals & I will continue to support funding + legislation that does just that. https://t.co/2E81ceb550
Savanna’s Act is about empowering law enforcement to better respond to cases of missing & murdered Native Americans to prevent similar tragedies and bring offenders to justice.

Congress approved this funding on a bipartisan basis to ensure that our nation is doing all we can to combat the Coronavirus.

This legislation supports vital prevention and treatment efforts, including vaccine research and development, in order to protect the American people. https://t.co/Z5GoFAEARw

Highlighted #NDTech today at the Great Northern Regional Robotics Competition & talked to students about the wide range of career opportunities #NorthDakota has to offer as we continue working to provide greater certainty to entrepreneurs & better access to #STEM education. https://t.co/SrHCdcLA6W

This week #NorthDakota @CRuralHealth stopped by to update me on important work they are doing to deliver quality health care across the state & discuss ways to enhance the health care workforce in rural areas. https://t.co/5BjTkwKfNj
RT @NCAI1944: .@SenJohnHoeven, Chairman of @USIndianAffairs, discussed the importance of public health and safety on reservations highlight…

The President’s #SOTU address tonight covered key priorities for our nation & for #NorthDakota. Strong economic growth, higher wages, implementing new trade agreements, reducing health care costs, securing our borders + more. https://t.co/84HvtcHUQG
RT @SecAzar: Thanks to @SenJohnBarrasso, @SenJohnHoeven, @SenDougJones, @RepArrington, and @RepCheri for their leadership on #ruralhealth.…
As we approach #VeteransDay, we remain committed to #NDveterans & ensuring they have the health care, benefits & recognition they deserve. https://t.co/A3JB3lzAKE

This week on the Senate floor I outlined the #SUPPORTAct & it’s efforts to combat the opioid & substance abuse epidemic. First responders, law enforcement & health care providers need to be equipped to prevent drug abuse, treat those suffering from addiction & assist recovery. https://t.co/z61LSX7PJP

Joined my Senate colleagues in voting to uphold 1332 State Innovation Waivers. These waivers give states greater flexibility to provide consumers w/ more choices & access to health insurance options, while maintaining requirements for pre-existing conditions.

Intro’d TBI & PTSD Treatment Act w/ @SenKevinCramer today directing the @DeptVetAffairs to provide HBOT for #veterans. All veterans deserve access to the best possible health care, we’re thankful HBOT is underway for #NDveterans.  https://t.co/TKg3EDYhTS

I look forward to working with James Byrne as VA Deputy Secretary to enhance health care & benefits available to #NDveterans such as improving access to local providers, opening mental health care options & ensuring long-term care facilities accept #veteran patients.

The @DeptVetAffairs has added @fargovahcs to its HBOT clinical demonstration program – great opportunity for #NDveterans to access to alt. treatment for PTSD. Part of our meeting on improving vets’ access to local health care, LTC & ensuring timely appts. https://t.co/gPHQaUxRdM

Today at @UnitedTribesND Tribal Leaders Summit, I outlined legislative efforts as @IndianCommittee Chairman to empower economic growth, improve public safety & ensure access to quality health care, education & housing in Indian Country. https://t.co/1QvYp1491K

Joined local leaders & health care professionals at Unity Medical Center to break ground on their new facility. Modernizing & updating UMC will help them continue to provide critical services & it’s all thanks to local, state & federal funds coming together. https://t.co/p9votQ7ZO5

At #UAS19, I announced @GenAtomics_ASI, tenant of @GrandSkyUAS, has received a COA to conduct #BVLOS flights within 60 miles of @319ABW w/o a chase plane or observer - further proof that #NDUAS is the location of choice for UAS R&D, testing & ops.

#BVLOS operations are critical to the dev. & testing of UAS tech. We’ve worked w/ @FAANews to make #NDUAS a unique ecosystem for unmanned aviation – urging the agency to provide clear req. to @NPUASTS & NDDOT to safely integrate this tech into our airspace.

This week I presented the @SafeKids Outstanding Lead Agency award to Sanford Children’s Hospital of #Fargo & Altru Health Systems of #GrandForks. Thank you to these #ND health care providers partnering w/ Safe Kids Worldwide to help keep kids in our state out of harm’s way. https://t.co/Ef7XDiXom6

This week, I met Danika & learned about her story living w T1D. We discussed lowering health care costs & improving transparency, including access to affordable insulin. #JDRFCC19 https://t.co/tWBH3Y2nTI

Our #NDveterans have sacrificed so much for our nation & it’s important that we continue working to implement the #VAMISSIONAct & ensure it properly meets our goal of providing all veterans w/ access to health care & long-term care closer to home. https://t.co/UdIqfwlDj1

Congrats to @fargovahcs Med Center Director Lavonne Liversage on her retirement this week – thanks for all of her service to #NDveterans & for working w/ us on the Vets Care Coordination Initiative to  bring veteran access to health care closer to home. https://t.co/9gHum5I3CO

#Broadband supports economic development, increases access to health care services & expands ed opps for students—that’s why this week, @SenKevinCramer, @RepArmstrongND & I urged FCC to improve broadband maps to provide better access. Read more here ↓ https://t.co/MGOyMdHB0K

The Admin’s conscience protection rule supports religious freedom & the sanctity of life by ensuring healthcare providers aren’t forced to violate their religious beliefs. Rule is similar to the Conscience Protection Act, bill I helped intro to provide these important protections

Thanks to @SecretarySonny for joining me at the unveiling of #grandfarm, a project led by @emergingprairie to develop the next gen of #precisionag. This showcases our growing tech sector & its benefits to our farmers & #NDag. Read more about his visit ↓ https://t.co/zsAns3tkVp
RT @KVRRTV: .@SenJohnHoeven Hosts @NDNationalGuard Discussion on Fargo Operations Facility, Tuition Assistance & Health Care https://t.co/0…

Thank you to @NDNationalGuard & NDSU ROTC leadership for bringing valuable input to our roundtable today. I’m committed to supporting the 119th Wing’s Reaper mission & to ensuring our Guardsmen & Reservists can fully access the health & education benefits they’ve earned. https://t.co/zjH4M9vWqc

Holding roundtable w/ @NDNationalGuard & NDSU ROTC leaders later this morning in #Fargo to outline our work to improve health & education benefits for Guardsmen & Reservists as well as efforts to secure a new operations facility for the 119th Wing’s MQ-9 mission.

We appreciate @SecretarySonny promptly approving our request to provide LIP assistance to help #ranchers recover from devastating losses & extreme weather events.
https://t.co/Cdc2sIbzNs
Our @NDNationalGuard demonstrates excellence in service. I discussed w/ @USNationalGuard Chief, Gen. Joseph Lengyel our efforts to improve Guard & Reserve education & health benefits. (1/2)
